page.title: 06The Church, Brightwell B
page.content: The church of Saint Bartholomew is a fine, stone building set on a green bank in Brighwell Baldwin. The present church is mainly fourteenth century. The church contains many interesting features, including a large brass of the Cottesmore family. Sir John Cottesmore, whose father acquired part of the Manor of Brighwell early in the thirteenth century, died in 1439. A stone chapel was created in the seventeenth century by John Stone, whose wife was the heiess to the Manor of Brightwell Baldwin. The Tower was restored in 1911 and contains the bells and a clock.
